natural problem: If $2010a + 2014b = 2018$ and $2012a + 2016b = 2020$, what is the value of $a - b$ ?
natural solution: Subtracting the two equations gives: \begin{align} (2012a + 2016b)-(2010a + 2014b) &= 2020-2018\\ 2a+2b &= 2\\ a+b &= 1 \end{align}Multiplying this equation by 2010 and subtracting the resulting equation from $ 2010a + 2014b=2018$ gives \begin{align}

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "2010 * a + 2014 * b = 2018"
and h1 : "2012 * a + 2016 * b = 2020"
shows  "a - b = -3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 If $2010a + 2014b = 2018$ and $2012a + 2016b = 2020$, what is the value of $a - b$ ? The final Answer is -3
 ### Proof
 Subtracting the two equations gives: \begin{align} (2012a + 2016b)-(2010a + 2014b) &= 2020-2018\\ 2a+2b &= 2\\ a+b &= 1 \end{align}Multiplying this equation by 2010 and subtracting the resulting equation from $ 2010a + 2014b=2018$ gives \begin{align}
 4b &= (2010a + 2014b) - 2010(a+b) \\\Rightarrow \qquad 4b &= 2018-2010 \\\Rightarrow \qquad 4b &= 8 \\\Rightarrow \qquad b &=2. \end{align}So $a-b = (a+b) - 2b = 1-4 = \boxed{-3}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "2010 * a + 2014 * b = 2018"
and h1 : "2012 * a + 2016 * b = 2020"
shows  "a - b = -3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem:
If the system of equations is 
$2010a + 2014b = 2018$ and 
$2012a + 2016b = 2020$, 
find the value of $a - b$. The final answer is $-3$.
